channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: French Bank Customers Hit by 'Quishing' Scam Using Fake Physical Cards
item.description:
A highly deceptive phishing campaign, dubbed 'quishing,' is targeting bank customers in France using a blend of physical and digital tactics. Scammers are sending official-looking letters by postal mail that contain a high-quality counterfeit bank card. The letter instructs the recipient to 'activat...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Data of 17.5 Million Instagram Users Leaked on Hacker Forum After Scraping Attack
item.description:
The personal data of approximately 17.5 million Instagram users has been leaked on the BreachForums hacking forum. The data, posted by a user named 'Solonik,' was allegedly obtained via automated data scraping from public APIs. The leaked information includes full names, email addresses, phone numbe...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: FBI: North Korea's Kimsuky APT Using 'Quishing' to Bypass MFA
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a formal advisory warning that the North Korean state-sponsored threat group Kimsuky (also known as APT43) is actively using malicious QR codes in spear-phishing emails. This tactic, dubbed 'quishing,' is designed to bypass traditional email ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Black Cat Group Targets Notepad++ Users in Massive SEO Poisoning Campaign
item.description:
The notorious Black Cat (ALPHV) cybercrime group is behind a large-scale SEO poisoning campaign that uses malicious advertisements and manipulated search results to distribute an information-stealing backdoor. The campaign targets users searching for popular software like Notepad++. Victims are lure...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: VVS Stealer Malware Uses PyArmor Obfuscation to Target Discord Users
item.description:
A new information-stealing malware named VVS Stealer is being sold on Telegram and used to target Discord users. Written in Python, the stealer's key feature is its use of the legitimate tool PyArmor to heavily obfuscate its code, allowing it to bypass static analysis and signature-based antivirus d...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware
item.description:
HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals a significant evolution in social engineering tactics, with cybercriminals using highly convincing lures such as professional animations and fake legal warnings to trick users into downloading malware. The report highlights a campaign impersonating the Colo...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: 900,000+ Users Compromised: Malicious Chrome Extensions Steal ChatGPT & DeepSeek Conversations
item.description:
A significant data theft campaign has been uncovered involving two malicious Google Chrome extensions that were installed by over 900,000 users. The extensions, which impersonated legitimate AI productivity tools, were designed to secretly capture and exfiltrate entire conversation histories from AI...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Data Breach, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Living Off the Cloud: Phishing Campaign Abuses Google Cloud Service to Bypass Security Filters
item.description:
A widespread and sophisticated phishing campaign is abusing Google Cloud's own Application Integration service to send malicious emails that appear to come from a legitimate Google address ("noreply-application-integration@google.com"). This technique allows the emails to bypass standard security fi...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Cloud Security, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Typo in Windows Activation Script Leads to Cosmali Loader Malware Infection
item.description:
A typosquatting campaign discovered on December 26, 2025, is targeting users of the popular Microsoft Activation Scripts (MAS) tool. Attackers registered the domain `get.activate[.]win`, a common misspelling of the legitimate domain. Users who mistype the command are redirected to the malicious site...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: SEC Busts $14M AI-Powered Crypto Scam That Used Deepfakes
item.description:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has charged seven entities for their involvement in a sophisticated cryptocurrency investment scam that defrauded retail investors of over $14 million. The scheme, which ran for a year, used social media ads featuring deepfake videos of financial pro...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence
